By Toa3t on Friday, October 3, 2003 - 07:05 pm:

The first step is, of course, having terrible stats. 1 SPD AND Slim? Daaaamn. He doesn't really make up for it with the techs, low skill, and other stuff. C'mon, Slappy, don't waste our time ^_^ Jus' kidding...

On to actual predictions:

Disciple will amaze me if he wins one single battle, I kid you not.

Powerhouse is head and shoulders above of anyone else in this bracket with the signature greatness of tech selection and stats associated with the HR ranch. He gets to win, but maybe not by a huge margin.

Welcome has a chance to win thanks to the excellent Punch Combo, but that costs guts and he won't have many to spare (not that anyone in this class will, actually).

As for Suzearin, he'll get hit every time or just about and he has much worse tech and stat selection that his Durahan brother. He'll give the Gobi a run for the money in the same way Tampa Bay gives Detroit a good challenge.

Oh, and it's weird to see that these are all HAD monsters.

One more thing, Fen... I've heard rumors that there'd be no A5, is that true?

By torey luvullo on Sunday, October 5, 2003 - 07:00 am:

MORNING LINE


Very unusual event. 2 golems take on 2 durahans...almost seems like it should be tag team.

MonsterBreedTrainerOdds
WelcomeDurahanRedHare8-5
PowerhouseBattleRocksHellraiser9-5
SuzerainDurahanInfernus6-1
DiscipleGobiSlapshotz6-1


I think you can see, i view this as a two monster event. Out of the 2, I chose Welcome. I love the speed, and he seems to have enough of the good techs that with a little tech selection, he can outpoint the slams of Powerhouse. Any Durahan suckiness will immediately be pounced on by the BattleRocks, however, and even without cyclone, he has the techs he needs to punish his enemies - and even a little speed.

Suzerain has all the Durahan suckiness, and not enough of the techs. Disciple has cyclone, but has no speed and gives up 16 lvl points to the top two.

Good luck to all!
